title: Change in eth_getTransactionCount  RPC response on develop branch
body:
With exactly the same (private) chain running locally, I get different responses from different versions of `geth`. Running `geth` v1.3.3:

```
 ~> curl -X POST --data '{"jsonrpc":"2.0","method":"eth_getTransactionCount","params":["0xaeafbd423c1620453bd3284e09cdf543e136dd0e","latest"],"id":1}' http://127.0.0.1:8545
{"id":1,"jsonrpc":"2.0","result":"0x26"}
 ~> curl -X POST --data '{"jsonrpc":"2.0","method":"eth_getTransactionCount","params":["0xaeafbd423c1620453bd3284e09cdf543e136dd0e","pending"],"id":1}' http://127.0.0.1:8545
{"id":1,"jsonrpc":"2.0","result":"0x26"}
```

Running `geth` from the develop branch (63e76482ac0):

```
 ~> curl -X POST --data '{"jsonrpc":"2.0","method":"eth_getTransactionCount","params":["0xaeafbd423c1620453bd3284e09cdf543e136dd0e","latest"],"id":1}' http://127.0.0.1:8545
{"jsonrpc":"2.0","id":1,"result":"0x26"}
 ~> curl -X POST --data '{"jsonrpc":"2.0","method":"eth_getTransactionCount","params":["0xaeafbd423c1620453bd3284e09cdf543e136dd0e","pending"],"id":1}' http://127.0.0.1:8545
{"jsonrpc":"2.0","id":1,"result":"0x0"}
```

Thanks for reporting this issue. I've actually noticed this myself while we were working over the weekend at the Gophergala hackington.

It appears that the pending state is that of an empty state while it should be that of the current, pending, accumulated state. I'll look in to this.

Running the RPC tests https://github.com/ethereum/rpc-tests

```
  12) eth_getTransactionByBlockNumberAndIndex GO should return transactions for the pending block when using "pending" and sending transactions before:
     Uncaught AssertionError: is object: expected null to be an object
      at Function.assert.isObject (node_modules/chai/lib/chai/interface/assert.js:528:35)
      at test/eth_getTransactionBy.js:24:20
      at xhr.onreadystatechange (lib/helpers.js:40:29)

      at setState (node_modules/xmlhttprequest/lib/XMLHttpRequest.js:610:14)
      at IncomingMessage.<anonymous> (node_modules/xmlhttprequest/lib/XMLHttpRequest.js:447:13)
      at _stream_readable.js:920:16
```
Ok, this is strange because we do get back the block and serialize it to a flat map, but then the response is lost inside the RPC implementation somehow and never sent out.

This is a tricky construct that sort of doesn't do it's job: https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/blob/develop/rpc/types.go#L176

An interface{} is only nil, if it was passed nil. A nil pointer however is already "something" so it's not nil any more. http://play.golang.org/p/1SomgEimrM

The check doesn't hurt per se, but we need to handle nil big.Ints within the big.Int branch. And no, this does not fix the issue yet.
This should be fixed in develop for a while now. Closing. Please reopen if you still see any issues.
I am getting timeouts when calling "eth_getTransactionCount" with geth@1.5.2. Query is sent to RPC interface and times out with 504.
